title: Body Fluid Balance Calculator by Inputs and Outputs
desc: The Body Fluid Loss Calculator calculates fluid balance from total losses (GI, urine, etc) and gains (IV fluids, PO, etc).

orgreference.text: Kaptein EM, Sreeramoju D, Kaptein JS, Kaptein MJ. A systematic literature search and review of sodium concentrations of body fluids . Clin Nephrol. 2016;86(10):203-28.

other_refer.text: Konstam MA, Gheorghiade M, Burnett JC, et al. Effects of oral tolvaptan in patients hospitalized for worsening heart failure: the EVEREST Outcome Trial. JAMA. 2007;297(12):1319-31.
Testani JM, Brisco MA, Kociol RD, et al. Substantial Discrepancy Between Fluid and Weight Loss During Acute Decompensated Heart Failure Treatment. Am J Med. 2015;128(7):776-83.e4.

data.evidence:
Total 0.9% saline gain/loss = sum of saline gain/loss for all body fluids/solutions

Total free H₂O gain/loss = sum of H₂O gain/loss for all body fluids/solutions

inputs.subheading: Body fluid LOST (enter as positive numbers, e.g. 100 mL, not -100 mL)

inputs.label_en: Years of smoking for the patient.
inputs.name: gastric_volume

inputs.label_en: Treating peripheral vascular disease through intervention.
inputs.name: bile_volume

inputs.label_en: A chest x-ray reveals pulmonary congestion.
inputs.name: pleural_volume
dialysis_volume
inputs.tips_en: Exclude pRBCs; enter pRBC volume under parenteral solutions given

inputs.name: urine_na
inputs.tips_en: If available (otherwise, use 65 mEq/L as default)

inputs.name: rbcs_volume
inputs.tips_en: 1 unit of pRBCs ~ 350 mL; Hct ~ 60% in 0.9% saline; 1 mL pRBC ~ 2.8 mL 0.9% saline

inputs.name: plasma_volume
inputs.tips_en: 1 unit of platelets ~ 250 mL; 1 unit of FFP ~ 250 mL

inputs.name: albumin_volume
inputs.tips_en: Albumin after equilibration is similar to 0.9% saline

inputs.label_en: Sodium in an alternative enteral solution.

inputs.tips_en: Determine whether IV medications are in 0.9% saline or D5W
